amendment.description: To express the sense of the Senate that homeland security grants to States and local governments awarded pursuant to section 1014 of the USA PATRIOT ACT of 2001 (42 U.S.C. 3711) should be allocated to States through a threat-based formula, with minimum allocations for small States.

action.text: Proposed amendment SA 1348 withdrawn in Senate.

Amendment SA 1348 proposed by Senator Clinton. (consideration: CR S9774, S9775-9778; text: CR S9774) To express the sense of the Senate that homeland security grants to States and local governments awarded pursuant to section 1014 of the USA PATRIOT ACT of 2001 (42 U.S.C. 3711) should be allocated to States through a threat-based formula, with minimum allocations for small States.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1348 proposed by Senator Clinton.
